University of Naples Federico II: The University of Naples Federico II (Italian: Universit√† degli Studi di Napoli Federico II) is a public research university in Naples, Campania, Italy. Established in 1224 and named after its founder, Frederick II, it is the oldest public, secular, non-sectarian or state-funded university in the world,[1][2][3] and one of the world's ten oldest universities in continuous operation.[4][5][6]
